summary: This document is an email chain from July 8, 2019, among staff at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, finalizing a press release regarding Jeffrey Epstein. The chain includes the draft text of a quote from an FBI Assistant Director urging victims to call the FBI tip line.

persons.name: Jeffery Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the press release being finalized; the FBI is asking for victims or those with information about his alleged criminal behavior to come forward.

persons.name: FBI Assistant Director
persons.context: Quoted in the draft press release, making a public appeal for victims of Jeffrey Epstein to contact the FBI.

events.title: Finalization of Epstein Press Release
events.description: Staff at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York coordinate via email to finalize a press release regarding Jeffrey Epstein, confirming the use of the 1-800-CALL-FBI number for victims.

keyFacts: On July 8, 2019, the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was finalizing a press release regarding Jeffrey Epstein.
The press release included a direct quote from an FBI Assistant Director urging victims of Epstein or those with information to call 1-800-CALL-FBI.
The FBI's message emphasized that victims should come forward 'regardless of the age you are now... no matter the incident that took place.'
The email chain shows internal coordination to confirm the correct contact number (the FBI tip line) for the public release.
The document is heavily redacted, with most sender/recipient names and email addresses obscured, indicating it was part of official DOJ communications.
